module.name: LazFileCache
module.short: Implements a caching mechanism for file and directory state information.

descr.p: lazfilecache.pas implement a caching mechanism used for file and directory state information. It is used in the implementation of the Lazarus IDE, and in the LCL package system.
This file is part of the LazUtils package.

element.name: TFileStateCacheItemFlag
element.short: Represents flag values used for files or directories in the state caching mechanism.

descr.p: TFileStateCacheItemFlag is an enumerated type with values that represent flags used for files or directories in the state caching mechanism. Values from the enumeration are stored in the TFileStateCacheItemFlags set type, and used in the implementation of the TFileStateCacheItem class.

element.short: File or directory exists.

element.name: TFileStateCacheItemFlag.fsciDirectory

element.name: TFileStateCacheItemFlag.fsciReadable

element.name: TFileStateCacheItemFlag.fsciWritable
element.short: File is writable.

element.name: TFileStateCacheItemFlag.fsciDirectoryReadable
element.short: File is a directory and can be searched.

element.name: TFileStateCacheItemFlag.fsciDirectoryWritable
element.short: File is a directory and allows new files to be created.

element.name: TFileStateCacheItemFlag.fsciText
element.short: File is a text (not an executable binary) file.

element.name: TFileStateCacheItemFlag.fsciExecutable

element.name: TFileStateCacheItemFlag.fsciPhysical

element.name: TFileStateCacheItem
element.short: Contains information about a file or directory in the state caching mechanism.

descr.p: TFileStateCacheItem is a class which contains information about a file or directory in the state caching mechanism. TFileStateCacheItem has properties used to represent a file or directory name (symbolic and physical), a timestamp, and status flags.
TFileStateCacheItem is the type creates and stored in the internal AVL tree in TFileStateCache using its FindFile method.

element.name: TFileStateCacheItem.TimeStamp
element.short: Timestamp for the cached item.

descr.p: Timestamp is an Int64 property with a timestamp value for an item in the state caching mechanism. It is not actually a time value; it is a counter that is assigned when the item is added to the TFileStateCache class. It can be compared to the Timestamp value in the state cache to determine when the item is potentially out-of-date.
Use TFileStateCache.Timestamp to determine when the cached item is invalid.

element.name: TFileStateCacheItem.Age
element.short: FileAge value for the file or directory.

descr.p: Age is a LongInt property with the file age for the file or directory in the cache item. The value for the property is assigned when the TFileStateCache.FileAgeCached method is called, and contains the value returned from the FileAge routine in SysUtils.

element.name: TFileStateCache
element.short: Implements a state caching mechanism for files and directories.

descr.p: TFileStateCache is a class which implements a state caching mechanism for files and directories. TFileStateCache uses an internal AVL tree to store TFileStateCacheItem instances for the items in the state caching mechanism. The tree stores values sorted in file name (or path) order.

The TimeStamp property contains a counter value, assigned in the constructor, which is maintained when items are added or updated in cache storage. The value is assigned to cached items, and provides an indication when the cached item may be out-of-date in the cache.
TFileStateCache provides methods to add and update items in the cache, and to access and verify state flags for the TFileStateCacheItem instances.

element.name: TFileStateCache.SetFlag
element.short: Includes or excludes a value in the Flags property.

element.name: TFileStateCache.SetFlag.AFile
element.short: File or directory name for the cached item.

element.name: TFileStateCache.SetFlag.AFlag
element.short: Identifies the Flag affected in the method.

element.name: TFileStateCache.SetFlag.NewValue
element.short: True to include the flag, False to exclude it.

element.name: TFileStateCache.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance. It allocates resources needed for the internal AVL tree used to store the file or directory items in the cache mechanism. The address for the CompareFileStateItems routine is used to compare and sort the items added to the AVL tree. It also sets the initial value in the Timestamp property.

element.name: TFileStateCache.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It frees resources allocated in and for the internal AVL tree used to store cached file or directories. It also frees any change handler routines assigned by calling the AddChangeTimeStampHandler method.
Destroy calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TFileStateCache.Lock
element.short: Increments the lock count for the caching mechanism.

element.name: TFileStateCache.Unlock
element.short: Decrements the lock count for the caching mechanism.

descr.p: Raises an Exception if the lock count is 0 (or less) when the method is called.

element.name: TFileStateCache.Locked
element.short: Indicates Lock has been called without a corresponding Unlock call.
element.descr: The return value is True when the internal lock count has a positive non-zero value.

element.name: TFileStateCache.Locked.Result
element.short: True when the internal lock count has a positive non-zero value.

element.name: TFileStateCache.IncreaseTimeStamp
element.short: Increments the change counter or updates an item in the state cache.

descr.p: AFileName contains the file or directory name to update in the storage for the cache.

When AFileName is an empty string (''), the entire cache is invalidated by incrementing the change counter in the TimeStamp property. If a value is provided in AFileName, a single item is invalidated in the cache storage. The FindFile method is called to retrieve the TFileStateCacheItem entry and to reset the values in its TestedFlags property.
IncreaseTimeStamp signals each of the assigned change handlers for the class instance using the value in AFileName as an argument.

element.name: TFileStateCache.IncreaseTimeStamp.AFilename
element.short: Name for the file or directory invalidated in the cache, or an empty string to invalidate all cached items.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileExistsCached
element.short: Ensures that a cached item has an up-to-date "file exists" flag value.

descr.p: FileExistsCached ensures that a cached item with the name in AFileName has an up-to-date "file exists" flag value in the cache.
Calls Check to use the valid flag value for an existing TFileStateCacheItem instance in the cache. If the return value from Check is True, no additional actions are performed in the method.

Otherwise, the flag value was not present for the specified cache item. The FileExistsUTF8 routine is called to determine if the file exists on the local file system. SetFlag is called to update the fsciExists flag for the cache item with the given name.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileExistsCached.Result
element.short: True if the file exists on the local file system and in the cache.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileExistsCached.AFilename
element.short: Name for the file to examine in the method.

element.name: TFileStateCache.DirPathExistsCached
element.short: Ensures that a cached item has an up-to-date "directory path exists" flag value.

descr.p: DirPathExistsCached ensures that a cached item with the name in AFileName has an up-to-date "directory path exists" flag value in the cache.
Calls Check to use the valid flag value for an existing TFileStateCacheItem instance in the cache. If the return value from Check is True, no additional actions are performed in the method.

Otherwise, the flag value was not present for the specified cache item. The DirPathExists routine is called to determine if the file exists on the local file system. SetFlag is called to update the fsciDirectory flag for the cache item with the given name.

element.name: TFileStateCache.DirPathExistsCached.Result
element.short: True if the directory exists on the local file system and in the cache.

element.name: TFileStateCache.DirPathExistsCached.AFilename
element.short: Name of the directory to examine in the method.

element.name: TFileStateCache.DirectoryIsWritableCached
element.short: Ensures that a cached item has an up-to-date "Directory is Writable" flag.

descr.p: DirectoryIsWritableCached ensures that the specified directory has an up-to-date value for its "Directory is Writable" flag in the cache. It calls Check to use a valid flag value for an existing TFileStateCacheItem instance in the cache. If the return value from Check is True, no additional actions are performed in the method.

Otherwise, the flag value was not present for the specified cache item. The DirectoryIsWritable routine is called to determine if the directory allows new entries to be created in the path. SetFlag is called to update the fsciDirectoryWritable flag for the cache item with the given name.

element.name: TFileStateCache.DirectoryIsWritableCached.Result
element.short: True if the specified directory is writable in the local file system and in the cache.

element.name: TFileStateCache.DirectoryIsWritableCached.DirectoryName
element.short: Name of the directory to examine in the method.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileIsExecutableCached
element.short: Ensures that the "File is Executable" flag is up-to-date for a cache item.

descr.p: FileIsExecutableCached ensures that the cache item for the specified file has an up-to-date value in its "File is Executable" flag. It calls Check to get the cache item with the given name, and to examine its flag values. If Check returns True for the flag, no additional actions are performed in the method.
Otherwise, the FileIsExecutable routine is called to get the return value. SetFlag is called to apply the fsciExecutable flag value to the cached item.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileIsExecutableCached.Result
element.short: True if the specified file is an executable binary.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileIsExecutableCached.AFilename
element.short: Name for the file examined in the method.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileIsReadableCached.AFilename

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileIsWritableCached.AFilename

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileAgeCached
element.short: Ensures that the file age is up-to-date for a cache item.

descr.p: FileAgeCached differs from the related methods in the class instance. It returns a LongInt value instead of a Boolean, and contains the value from the FileAge routine in the RTL SysUtils unit. The value represents the last date that the file was modified, and the integer value does not include any time-related information for the modification timestamp.
FileAgeCached cannot be used for directory names; the value is always -1 when used for a directory name.
FileAge is not related to the TimeStamp property for the cache.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileAgeCached.Result
element.short: File age (last modification date) for the file.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FileAgeCached.AFileName
element.short: Name for the file examined in the method.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FindFile
element.short: Gets (or creates) the cached item with the specified name.

descr.p: FindFile is a TFileStateCacheItem function used to get, or optionally create, a cache entry for the file or directory in Filename.

FindFile resolves a relative path used in Filename by calling the ResolveDots routine. The normalized name is used to get the TFileStateCacheItem instance in the cache used as the return value for the method.

If Filename was not found in the cache, and CreateIfNotExists is set to True, a TFileStateCacheItem instance is created with the Timestamp for the cache and added to the internal storage. An Exception is raised if the cache item could not be added (and retrieved) using the internal AVL tree storage.
If Filename was not found in the cache, and CreateIfNotExists is set to False, the return value is Nil.
FindFile is used to implement the Check and IncreaseTimeStamp methods.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FindFile.Result
element.short: Cached item with the specified name, or Nil.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FindFile.Filename
element.short: Name for the file or directory to locate in the cache.

element.name: TFileStateCache.FindFile.CreateIfNotExists
element.short: True to create a cache item if it does not already exist.

element.name: TFileStateCache.Check
element.short: Checks the specified cache item to get a specific flag value.

descr.p: Check is a Boolean function used to check a flag value in a cache item with the name in Filename.
AFlag identifies the flag value checked for the cache item.

AFile contains the cache item used to get the value for the specified flag. The FindFile method is called to get (or create) a cache item for the specified file or directory name. AFile is an output parameter, and is used to return the TFileStateCacheItem instance to the caller.

Check ensures that the cache item is valid (recent) using the Timestamp for the class instance. When TimeStamp is more recent than the value in the cache item, the cache item is updated with the current Timestamp and its tested flags are cleared.

FlagIsSet is a variable parameter which contains the state for the specific flag. True indicates the flag is set for the cache item. False indicates that the flag was not already set in the cache item, or has not been tested after resetting the Timestamp for an invalid cache item.

The return value is True when the flag in AFlag is one of the tested flags in an existing cache item. It is False if the flag value has not been accessed in the cache item, or when the Timestamp for an invalid cache item was reset.
Check is used to implement methods which get or set specific flag values, including:

element.name: TFileStateCache.Check.AFlag

element.name: TFileStateCache.Check.AFile
element.short: The cache item examined in the method.

element.name: TFileStateCache.Check.FlagIsSet
element.short: True if the flag was tested and set for the cache item.

element.name: GetPhysicalFilenameCached
element.short: Gets the physical file name for the specified file or directory name.

descr.p: GetPhysicalFilenameCached is a String function used to get the physical file name for the value specified in AFileName. The return value contains the actual file name for a symbolic link or reference on the local file system.
EmptyOnError indicates that the return value can be an empty string ('') if AFilename cannot be resolved. When set to False, the original file in AFileName is used as the return value.
GetPhysicalFilenameCached provides two (2) ways to resolve the value in AFilename:

ul.li: Calling the GetPhysicalFilenameCached method in the FileStateCache singleton (when assigned). This is the default code path in the routine.

element.name: InvalidateFileStateCache
element.short: Invalidates one or more items in the state cache.

descr.p: Calls the IncreaseTimeStamp method in FileStateCache using the value in FileName as the target. When FileName exists in the cache, it is the only item affected in the method. If FileName is an empty string (''), all items in the cache are invalidated.
